thread.section_title: Others - More sports - Sports - The Times of India
thread.title: Gujarat swimmers leave for Asian age-group championship in Bangkok
thread.title_full: Gujarat swimmers leave for Asian age-group championship in Bangkok - The Times of India

author: Ajit Bezbaruah
title: Gujarat swimmers leave for Asian age-group championship in Bangkok
text:
AHMEDABAD: A 75-member strong Indian team leaves for Bangkok on Monday evening to take part in the 8th Asian Age Group Championships scheduled to be held there from October 1 to 7.
Five swimmers from Gujarat-Neil Contractor, Anshul Kothari, Shiven Brahmbhatt, Rutvik Bhatt and Maana Patel-are part of the Indian contingent which will take part in swimming, diving and water polo events.
While Neil, Anshul and Rutvik have qualified in the relay events, Shiven has qualified for the 50m freestyle and Maana have qualified for the 50m backstroke events. Among others, the two Gujaratis accompanying the team are physio Hiren Patel and Kamlesh Nanavati, who is not only their coach but also the secretary of the Swimming Federation of India (SFI).
Xavier's take on Army in Subroto U-17 opener: The St Xavier's High School, Loyola Hall U-17 football team left for New Delhi on Sunday to take part in the Subroto Mukherjee Football Tournament. They open their campaign in the junior category against Army Boys on September 30.
They next play Tamil Nadu, Chandigarh, Uttarakhand and Kerala on simultaneous days. The team comprises of Daren Job, Gajjar Jaydeep, Charles Pias, Jhala Prajwal, Kunal Patel, Adorn Chris, Poojan Rathod, Shane Joseph, Chris Dias, Vasihsth Joshi, Mritunjay Chauhan, Harsh Makhija, Ryan Gomes, Rihen Christian, Poojan Solanki and Kevin Christian. Sumit Azad is the coach and Prakash Chauhan is the manager of the team.
Big win for SGVP: SGVP defeated Delhi Public School by 114 runs in the Reliance Foundation U-19 Inter-School Tournament at SGVP play ground.
Brief scores: SGVP 179 in 42.2 overs (Manish Patel 69; Paru Parikh 4/24, Priyank Shah 4/30) bt Delhi Public School 65 in 18.3 overs (Vraj Bhatt 23; Manthan Bhavsar 3/21).
DBMS drub Navyug High School: DBMS (Kankaria) defeated Navyug High School by 10 wickets in the Hiramani School U-16 two-day tournament at Cn Vidhyalaya A ground.
Brief scores: Navyug HS: 73 in 21.4 overs (Prince Rana 26; Varun Joshi 5/33, Yash Panchal 3/9) lost to DBMS (Kankaria) 75/0 in 17.5 overs (Sidhant Dobariaya 37no, Jeet Khatri 31no).
St Kabir beat Best High School: St Kabir School defeated Best High School by virtue of the first innings lead in the HC Kapasi U-14 multi-day school tournament match played at Gujarat College B ground.
Brief scores: Best High School 139 in 47.4 overs (Rahul Thakore 59; Jay Shah 3/38) & 66/2 in 17 overs (Shrey Parsania 37; Aditya Singh 4/50) lost to St Kabir School 1st Innings 342/8 in 119 overs (Shantanu Sharma 95, Priyen Trivedi 79, Krish Sharma 62; Shrey Parsania 3/112).
